reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.5 ANGSTROMS) OF 25-234 IN COMPLEX WITH PRL

comment.text: This is a receptor for the anterior pituitary hormone prolactin (PRL). Acts as a prosurvival factor for spermatozoa by inhibiting sperm capacitation through suppression of SRC kinase activation and stimulation of AKT. Isoform 4 is unable to transduce prolactin signaling. Isoform 6 is unable to transduce prolactin signaling.
Homodimer upon hormone binding. Interacts with SMARCA1. Interacts with GH1. Interacts with CSH. Interacts with NEK3 and VAV2 and this interaction is prolactin-dependent.
Expressed in breast, placenta, kidney, liver and pancreas.
The WSXWS motif appears to be necessary for proper protein folding and thereby efficient intracellular transport and cell-surface receptor binding.
The box 1 motif is required for JAK interaction and/or activation.

disease.name: Multiple fibroadenomas of the breast
disease.description: A benign breast disease marked by lobuloalveolar growth with abnormally high proliferation of the epithelium, and characterized by the presence of more than 3 fibroadenomas in one breast. Fibroadenomas are adenomas containing fibrous tissue.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Hyperprolactinemia
disease.description: A disorder characterized by increased levels of prolactin in the blood not associated with gestation or the puerperium. HPRL may result in infertility, hypogonadism, and galactorrhea.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Soluble isoform that appears specific for the BT-474 breast cancer cell line.
Includes exon 11. Does not transduce prolactin signaling.
Produced by deletion of part of exon 10 and frameshift.
SF1b with deletion of exon 4. May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.
Belongs to the type I cytokine receptor family. Type 1 subfamily.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

property.value: Expressed in placenta and 165 other tissues
P:activation of transmembrane receptor protein tyrosine kinase activity
P:growth hormone receptor signaling pathway via JAK-STAT
P:positive regulation of cell population proliferation

feature.description: In MFAB; confers constitutive activity; dbSNP:rs72478580.
In HPRL; loss of function; dbSNP:rs398122522.
